plan.project_overview: Demo app with user authentication and profile management. Users can register and log in using email/password, view their profile after login, update profile fields (name, bio, avatar URL), and log out. API includes /auth/register, /auth/login, /me (GET, PATCH), and /auth/logout. Validation includes password length (>=8), valid email format, 401 for invalid token, and login rate limiting (5 attempts/min per IP).

tests.title: Register succeeds with valid email and password (>=8 chars)
preconditions: A unique email address not yet registered
steps: Send POST /auth/register with body: {"email":"new.user@example.com","password":"Passw0rd!"}
expected: Response status indicates success (e.g., 200/201)
Response does not include password in clear text
User can subsequently log in with the same credentials

tests.title: Register rejects invalid email format
steps: Send POST /auth/register with body: {"email":"not-an-email","password":"Passw0rd!"}
expected: Request is rejected with a 4xx validation error
Error message indicates invalid email

tests.title: Register rejects password shorter than 8 characters
steps: Send POST /auth/register with body: {"email":"short.pass@example.com","password":"1234567"}
expected: Request is rejected with a 4xx validation error
Error message indicates password must be 8+ characters

tests.title: Login succeeds with valid email + password
steps: Send POST /auth/login with body: {"email":"existing.user@example.com","password":"Passw0rd!"}
expected: Response status indicates success
An auth token/session is issued (e.g., access token in body or session cookie) that can be used for authenticated requests

tests.title: Login rejects wrong password
steps: Send POST /auth/login with body: {"email":"existing.user@example.com","password":"WrongPass1!"}
expected: Request is rejected with an authentication error (4xx)
No auth token/session is issued

tests.title: Login rate limit enforced: >5 attempts/min per IP are blocked
preconditions: Use a single client IP (no proxy rotation)
steps: Within 60 seconds, send 5 POST /auth/login requests with invalid credentials from the same IP
Send a 6th POST /auth/login request within the same 60-second window
expected: First 5 attempts return authentication failure (4xx) but are processed
6th attempt is blocked due to rate limiting (commonly 429 Too Many Requests) with a rate-limit related error message/headers if provided

tests.title: GET /me returns profile for authenticated user
preconditions: User is logged in and an auth token/session is available
steps: Send GET /me with valid auth token/session
expected: Response status is success (200)
Response contains the user's profile data (including fields such as name, bio, avatar URL as applicable)
Returned profile corresponds to the authenticated user

tests.title: GET /me with missing or invalid token returns 401
steps: Send GET /me without auth token/session
Send GET /me with an invalid/expired token value
expected: Both requests return 401 Unauthorized

tests.title: PATCH /me updates name, bio, and avatar URL for authenticated user
preconditions: User is logged in and an auth token/session is available
steps: Send PATCH /me with valid auth token/session and body: {"name":"Test Name","bio":"Hello world","avatarUrl":"https://example.com/avatar.png"}
Send GET /me with the same auth token/session
expected: PATCH response indicates success
GET /me shows updated values for name, bio, and avatar URL

tests.title: PATCH /me with invalid token returns 401 and does not update profile
preconditions: A user exists with known current profile values
steps: Send PATCH /me with an invalid token and body: {"name":"Hacker Name"}
Authenticate properly as the same user and send GET /me
expected: PATCH returns 401 Unauthorized
Profile values remain unchanged (name is not updated)

tests.title: PATCH /me supports partial updates (update only one field)
preconditions: User is logged in and an auth token/session is available
User has existing values for name, bio, avatar URL
steps: Send PATCH /me with body: {"bio":"Updated bio only"}
Send GET /me
expected: PATCH response indicates success
Only bio changes; name and avatar URL remain unchanged

tests.title: Logout invalidates current session/token
preconditions: User is logged in and an auth token/session is available
steps: Send POST /auth/logout with valid auth token/session
Send GET /me using the same token/session as before logout
expected: Logout response indicates success
Subsequent GET /me returns 401 Unauthorized (token/session no longer valid)

tests.title: UI: End-to-end authentication flow (register/login -> view profile -> logout)
preconditions: Web UI is available for signup/login/profile
A unique email address is available for registration
steps: Open the app
Sign up with email and password (>=8 chars)
Log in with the same email and password (if signup does not automatically log in)
Navigate to profile page and view profile information
Log out
Attempt to navigate to the profile page again
expected: User can sign up and log in using email + password
After login, profile is viewable
After logout, profile is not accessible and user is prompted to log in (or otherwise blocked)

tests.title: Integration: UI profile update persists via API and is reflected on refresh
preconditions: Web UI is available for profile editing
User is registered and can log in
steps: Log in via UI
Edit profile fields (name, bio, avatar URL) via UI and save
Refresh the page or re-open the profile view
Optionally, call GET /me using the same session (if accessible in test harness) to confirm persisted values
expected: Updated name, bio, and avatar URL persist after refresh
Persisted values match what was submitted
